here.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: This switch here controls the lights.
My friend here will show you the way.
Will you be back here tonight?
There are no good pubs round here.
Let’s settle the matter here and now.
What was she doing up here in the woods?
Would you close the window? It’s cold in here.
here.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Here is your chance to change your life.
Here is where the trouble starts.
here.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: used when you are giving or offering something to someone
here.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Here, have my chair. I don’t mind standing.
here.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: at this point in a discussion
here.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Here I’d like to add a note of caution.
There is no space to discuss this issue here.
I’m not sure what you mean here.
here.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: used to get someone’s attention or to show that you are annoyed
here.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Here! Just what do you think you’re doing?
here.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with here
here.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0]: You use here on its own, when you are talking about a place or organization
The people in here are poor
here.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1]: You use in here when talking about the inside of a building, room, cupboard etc
There aren’t enough chairs in here
here.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2]: Before I came here, I didn’t speak any English
here.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: USAGE: Here is, there is
here.translation[0].note_box[1].items[0]: Use here is when giving or showing something to someone
Here is the book you wanted
here.translation[0].note_box[1].items[1]: Use there is or there are to say what is in a place
There are many species of birds here
Here are many species of birds
